thread.title: US futures point lower as Fed rate decision looms
thread.title_full: US futures point lower as Fed rate decision looms

title: US futures point lower as Fed rate decision looms
text:
US futures point lower as Fed rate decision looms By CNBC.com staff 1 hour ago ÓÅ± . View photo Getty Images. U.S. stock index futures indicated a lower open on Friday with traders cautious about next week's meeting of the U.S. Federal Reserve. 
U.S. stock index futures indicated a lower open on Friday with traders cautious about next week's meeting of the U.S. Federal Reserve and wary of any attempts by the market to rally. 
The Fed will meet on September 16 and 17, with the timing of the U.S. central bank's first rate hike in nine years a continued source of debate in the markets. 
In Europe, the pan-European STOXX 600 index was down about 1 percent, with investors also looking to next week's decision. In Asia, the Shanghai Composite Index (Shanghai Stock Exchange: .SSEC) closed 0.08 percent higher, while the Nikkei (Nihon Kenzai Shinbun: .N225) was down 0.19 percent. 
On the data front, Friday will see the release of PPI producer inflation data at 8:30am ET, with consumer sentiment data released at 10 a.m. 
In oil markets, Brent crude traded at around $47.82 a barrel, down 2.19 percent, while U.S. crude was at $44.85 a barrel, down 2.33 percent. 
On the earnings front, Kroger ( KR ) and Mattress Firm ( MFRM ) are both expected before the bell. 
--CNBC's Patti Domm contributed to this report. More From CNBC
